messages.title: 3 POSITIVE REASONS TO VOTE FOR LOANNA MORRISON
messages.content: Honest action on the economy, Higher standards in public services, Protect our local community.

messages.title: PROTECTING SMALL BUSINESSES
messages.content: Local businesses are the lifeblood of our community. Since the start of her campaign Loanna has won concessions to help small businesses combat the recession. The Conservatives have pledged to reduce corporation tax and cut Gordon Brownâ€™s National Insurance hike.

messages.title: STOPPING OVER-DEVELOPMENT
messages.content: Planners have more power than residents in Southwark and local consultations are a sham. Loanna has been questioning them, from Canada Water to Elephant & Castle, Downtown to Borough High Street. She is putting the pressure on so they listen to local people.

messages.title: A BRIGHTER FUTURE
messages.content: Young people are great asset and they deserve a better Loanna set up Fast-Track, a membership club to help young people find jobs, apprenticeships and training. Launched at Fisher Downside youth club, she will put Fast-Track in youth clubs across Southwark.

messages.title: HOME IMPROVEMENTS
messages.content: Loanna has helped hundreds of residents across Southwark with issues including housing repairs, overcrowding, leaks, asbestos, leaseholder and service charges. The quality of social housing is disgraceful and needs sorting out. This will be a top priority for Loanna as your MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for hard-working families, freeze council tax for two years, oppose Labour's National Insurance hike, and deal with the deficit.
Increase spending on health year-on-year, make the NHS work for patients not managers, give teachers the power to restore discipline and create smaller schools, and cut red tape in public services.
Fight for a common sense approach to housing, defend green spaces against over-development, pledge to protect local community with action to tackle crime and anti social behaviour.

issues.economy: Support hard-working families, freeze council tax for two years, oppose Labour's National Insurance hike, and deal with the deficit.
issues.education: Give teachers the power to restore discipline and create smaller schools.
issues.health: Increase spending on health year-on-year, make the NHS work for patients not managers.

housing.content: Fight for a common sense approach to housing and pledge to protect local community. Helped hundreds of residents across Southwark with issues including housing repairs, overcrowding, and leaks.

images.caption: Loanna Morrison standing with local community members.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet focuses on local economic development, public services, community protection, and housing issues. It also features endorsements from local business owners.
